variants.Description in input context: M26I, R98Q, D149A, L166P, and C106S

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Functional assays (protein stability, dimerization, and function)

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells expressing wild-type or mutant DJ-1 constructs were used.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Reduced protein stability, impaired dimerization, and functional defects
Readout description.Result Description: Mutants showed reduced protein stability, impaired dimerization, and functional defects compared to wild-type. C106S exhibited reduced ubiquitination.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 construct was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein stability and function within 80% of wild-type levels

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein stability or function reduced by >50% compared to wild-type
